head.title: Robin Souriau - JS fullstack developer, CV & Portfolio
head.description: React, NextJS, Node and Tailwind enthusiast. This is my personal portfolio and CV. Discover my works!

quote.part1: I see programming as a form of manual labor. A workshop containing tools, materials, and the ability to

paragraph1.part1: It's been 10 years of a long and rich voyage to be where I am today. From my first HTML & CSS tutorials to this very portfolio, my journey has been full of challenges and discoveries. Music interviews of major french Hip hop artists, project management, side projects with equal amount of enthusiasm. But at the end of the day, it seems that
paragraph1.part2: always ends up being the most important thing for me.

paragraph2.part1: In 2021, I decided to take a break from my job as a project manager to focus on my passion for programming. Through a 6 month intensive course at O'Clock, I learned the basics of web development and obtained my
paragraph2.strong1: Mobile and Web developer professional certificate
paragraph2.part2: to become a JS fullstack developer.

paragraph3.part1: because I love to be able to handle a bit of everything, from top to bottom. Code, might it be front-end or back-end, still remains code. It has the same magical attribute to build, solve, create.
paragraph3.part2: because ever since I was a kid, I've always been fascinated by this form of communication, and by the links it can create between people, the communities it can build.

paragraph4.part1: On a day to day basis, I work with
paragraph4.part4: on the back-end. In a small team of devs, we work with user stories and agile methodologies to deliver a product that meets the client's needs. In this case, the client might be both B2C (through our ecommerce solution) or B2B (through our production tracking solution). The app also serves as an internal tool across every branch of the company. The challenges comes in all forms, from bugfixes to new minor or major features, inherent to the will of growth of the company.

paragraph5.part1: With this working experience as a developer, I can both work on code and use my project management skills to help the team deliver the best product possible. I'm fond of working with diffent
paragraph5.part2: , both internal and external. I can deploy a taste for
paragraph5.part3: and adapting, always with this will to build great tools and services for all usages.

diggers.title: Fullstack JavaScript developer
diggers.description: Fullstack missions on a React/Next/Adonis stack, both for the ecommerce solution and internal application for a vinyl distribution company. Bugfixes, feature integration.

pimlicom.title: Digital project management
pimlicom.description: Digital project management for small to medium sized companies.  Content writing, audits and expertise on SEO/WordPress.

hypesoul.title: Journalist, web developer
hypesoul.description: Website management on WordPress, community management and interviews for a pure press Hip Hop media start up.
